chapter.title: Delegating Permissions to the State Education Organization
chapter.para: A local education organization (such as a district or county school system) can delegate some administrative responsibilities the state education organization in its hierarchy. That local organization can delegate the right to view security events on the organization's behalf.

The LEA administrator role is the administrator role associated with the local education organizations which can delegate these permissions. The recipient of the delegated permissions has the state level administrator role, SEA administrator.

For example, if a District D is part of State S, an LEA Administrator for District D can delegate security event viewing permission to State S. In this case, an SEA Administrator for State S will be able to view security events on behalf of District D.
Use the following steps to delegate permissions to the state level education organization:

step.para: Log in to &PRODUCTABBR; using your LEA administrator account.
Click Admin to open the administrator home page.
Click Delegate Administration under System Tools.
